result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. LaPalm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L. LaPalm

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:05 p.m. Defendant Brandon L. LaPalm in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. State moves to amend to Contribute to Deliquency of a Minor - a violation of 948.40(1) - a Class A Misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Victim and victim's mother present in Court but do not wish to make a statement. 
Court Sentence
Jail - 90 days CC
Jail credit - 84 days
Appeal rights given. Adj. 3:20 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:42 p.m. Defendant Brandon L. LaPalm in court via video with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon L. LaPalm in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Court explaints time limits to defendant. Time limits waived by defendant/Attorney Burns.
Bail continued. Adj. 2:47 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with any female under 18 years unless children living in home with him - No access to internet, text messages. No use of electronic media - cell phone, tablet, computer.

2:08 p.m. Defendant Brandon L. LaPalm in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant states he is represented by Mary Burns,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
